meanings.definition: A line that intersects a circle at two points.
meanings.sent1: The exsecant of the circle crossed at two points.
meanings.sent2: The exsecant of the circle showed where it intersected.
meanings.sent3: The exsecant of the circle seemed to play hopscotch on the edge.
meanings.sent4: The exsecant of the circle cut through like a sharp knife.
meanings.sent5: The exsecant of the circle was like a bold stroke on a canvas.

meanings.definition: To cut off or remove a section from something.
meanings.sent1: She needed to exsecant the damaged part of the fabric.
meanings.sent2: He carefully exsecanted the excess material from the design.
meanings.sent3: The tailor exsecanted the fabric with precision, like a surgeon.
meanings.sent4: The decision to exsecant the paragraph from the report was difficult.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor exsecanted the marble block to reveal the hidden figure within.
